attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.

attributes.action: Make final UK Brexit deal subject to binding, minimum 10% majority, referendum.
attributes.background: Current Brexit discussions are largely uninformed and confused. There's no reason to think that they will not remain post Article 50 triggering. Lies, half-truths were expounded, later admitted false. EU is UK's biggest market, we need to maintain our relationship and work to reform it from inside.
attributes.additional_details: The EU non-binding referendum in June 2016 gave options to stay in / out. 29m citizens did not vote Leave. The 4% majority: Leave vs Remain actual voters is an iniquitous outcome for the majority of citizens. Many failed to understand Leave implications fully. The issue is highly political and self serving for some individuals. Our EU membership is an economic - trade issue. Key are the Single Market and Customs Union, NOT immigration. Other options exist, but unquantified, thus risky.

attributes.action: Urban and suburban trees need protecting as if they were in a conservation area
attributes.background: Urban and suburban trees are not protected by the current system of getting Tree Preservation Orders for those under threat. The first thing that the community know about any threat is the chainsaws moving in and the trees disappearing. When the Tree Officer arrives, all that is left is the stump.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving all urban and suburban trees the same protection would give the Tree Officer time to visit vulnerable trees and make some decision on their amenity value to the whole community
We all deserve to enjoy trees as we walk to school, do our shopping and go about our daily lives, not just those lucky enough to be living in a conservation area. 
Ref : Trees in the Townscape - A Guide for Decision Makers   by ﻿The Trees and Design ﻿﻿Action﻿﻿ Group (﻿﻿TD﻿﻿AG)  www.tdag.org.uk

attributes.action: Make wrongful online doxing a criminal offence
attributes.background: Many people, often children, have their private details leaked online. This may include their phone number, address, or even personal photos. This is a form of cyber bullying if the person did not give permission for their details to be leaked. It is essential for this online attack to be illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
www.studyweb.com/doxing/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doxing
www.gohacking.com/what-is-doxing-and-how-it-is-done/

attributes.action: Cap insurance cancellation and ammendment charges to a reasonable admin fee only
attributes.background: After cancelling a policy for motor insurance having changed my vehicle I was charged a fee of I've £97 to cancel my policy. The price of the policy was only £277 to begin with, I this charge is completely unfair and unreasonable and feel a cap on these charges is required an admin fee of £25?

attributes.action: Replace 5p plastic bags for PAPER BAGS.
attributes.background:
We, students at the School of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Kingston University, would like to see the offer of plastic bags by supermarkets and shopping outlets replaced by PAPER bags instead.
Paper bags can be very sturdy and are eco-friendly. 
Please, join us in our campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
We are also having a competition of art work based on Paper Bags, which will be exhibited at Stanley Picker Gallery (London).
More details about will be available at our Twitter account: @PaperBagsKU

attributes.action: Make mental health services more accessible
attributes.background: To make mental health services more accessible the Government should ensure that  no-one who approaches a mental health service should be turned away without help.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone who goes to their GP or any other health care professional who is experiencing a mental health problem should be automatically referred to the crisis team who should act immediately. The onus should not be on the individual to contact the Crisis Team on their own. There should also always be a one to one therapy option, rather than group therapy.

Many people will know I haven't had an easy time with life or with mental illness; I suffer with depression anxiety PTSD and OCD. Recently, I've hit rock bottom and have screamed for help but have been let down by mental health services who I thought would help, instead they have let me down majorly.

attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: Change the motorway speed limit to 85 MPH.
attributes.background: The problem with motorways in UK that I find is that we have roads of good enough standard and management that could take up faster traffic.  I Really find a problem where it is allowed to go up to 60 MPH on a narrow road with sharp bends but only 70 MPH on wide and safe motorway.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries in europe have much higher motorway speed limit  road conditions: Belgium (74MPH), France, Austria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland (80 MPH), Germany (NONE - unless stated otherwise)
In some of those countries where the speed limit of 80 MPH applies the motorway road conditions are far much worse than in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: A Parliamentary review of the 2005 Change to the Double Jeopardy Law.
attributes.background: We believe the operation of the change in the the DJ law is not working as Parliament intended. We cite the example of Matthew Hamlen, a 37 year old electrician, and a married man with a son, currently in the custody of HMPS in the UK having been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment in February 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Change the age of the 30hrs free childcare to start at age 1 for working parents
attributes.background: The government are increasing the childcare hours from 15 to 30 for 3 and 4 year olds, but we as working parents are still struggling to pay for childcare for our babies as most women return to work after 9 months.  We want the age changed to start the 30hrs from the age of 1.

attributes.action: Reduce waiting times for domestic abuse and sexual assault counselling services.
attributes.background: The waiting list for counselling services following sexual assault or abuse is usually around 4 months for an assessment alone. Rape Crisis centres are experiencing more and more requests for support. Nearly a million people are raped every year, but in the last few years have had their funding cut.
attributes.additional_details:
Sexual assault and abuse are often seen as taboo and not spoken about. Many survivors suffer in silence, unable to get the help they need to recover. These types of crimes have the lowest conviction rates making survivors unable to speak up.

In my own and friends' experiences, people with PTSD are often turned away from most mental health services, including the NHS. Most of the UK do not have access to a Rape Crisis centre. This needs to change.

http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php

attributes.action: Public enquiry over the last decade regarding social service/cafcass failings
attributes.background:
The failings of both social services/cafcass
And reluctance to follow up on detrimental information their reluctance to participate this alienated parents and their dismissal of information
attributes.additional_details: Information can be supplied by various groups

attributes.action: Take fluffy bedding for hamsters off the shelves! It's dangerous!
attributes.background: In January 2016, I bought my first hamster & I now have 6! During this short time of owning hamsters I have observed posts on hamster forums  regarding the dangers of fluffy bedding. This bedding can cause serious injury & even fatality to a hamster as a direct consequence of using it.
attributes.additional_details:
Respiratory issues - If this bedding enters the hamsters lungs it can cause infection. In many cases this isn't curable & will lead to death. 

Blockages - If the hamster was to consume the bedding, and it is very possible, it can not be digested. This will lead to blockages within the hamsters system that can not be dislodge.

Limbs - The most common cause of injury regarding fluffy bedding is limb trapping. The bedding can trap the limbs within its fine strands resulting in amputation.

attributes.action: More funding and awareness of mental health issues in young adults
attributes.background: After many friends suffering from mental health issues, I felt that this was an important topic, as mental health is often seen as inferior to physical illnesses

attributes.action: Separate areas in hospitals for parents suffering a miscarriage or stillbirth
attributes.background: When a woman loses a baby or babies due to either a miscarriage or stillbirth they are placed on a maternity ward to recover. The woman who is grieving is surrounded by women who have just given birth and can hear babies crying. This is very hurtful and noway to help the healing process.
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of this and it is heartbreaking being left on a ward with babies crying when you are trying to come to terms with the fact you have just lost your baby. During my experience a midwife had come in the room and congratulated me only to be told that my baby hadn't survived. I believe a separate area would benefit parents and help with the healing process. An area where information could be talked about and not whispered and where midwives could not make a hurtful mistake

attributes.action: Stronger penalties for bullying, harassment and hate crime in the workplace.
attributes.background:
All of the above costs the UK economy loss of monies. It adversely impacts on the victim's career, physical and mental health and personal life. 

As per NHS choices one of the causes of suicide is bullying.
attributes.additional_details: The victim's voice is often lost. There is a general disbelief and isolation when the victim raises concerns through in house grievance processes. It is " institutional failure " when the victim is treated with a lack of humanity and lack of dignity at work. Hence, the victim needs to be supported through the government, parliament and petition. It benefits the UK economy and the victim both.

attributes.action: Introduce more tax for Buy To Let Landlords and Foreign Property Investors
attributes.background:
Homes are for living in, they are not pension pots. Prices are now ridiculous, driven up by greedy investors. Politicians fear losing elections if house prices fall, yet high prices do not even benefit them either.
Bring down house prices now!
attributes.additional_details:
Wages not in line with rising house prices. Drastic change is needed.
The entire economy should not be functioning on house prices.

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Make sex work a protected characteristic under the Equality Act
attributes.background: The 2010 Equality Act does not include sex workers e.g. escorts, strippers, and porn actors, as a protected characteristic. Former sex workers can be discriminated against at work e.g. teachers may be fired if their past is exposed, despite it not impacting their ability to do their job.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of sex workers are also women, LGBT+ (particularly transgender), disabled or belong to an ethnic minority. While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:
https://www.gov.uk/discrimination-your-rights/types-of-discrimination

attributes.action: Pressure Myanmar's government to stop the genocide against the Rohingya people
attributes.background: Decades of discrimination and dehumanisation of the Rohingya, an ethnic minority in Myanmar, has ultimately led to genocidal violence from political and religious leaders since 2012, which "may amount to crimes against humanity". The country's leader, a Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, sits idly by.
attributes.additional_details:
Described by the UN as "the world's most persecuted minority", the Rohingya are an ethnic minority who have lived in Myanmar's Arakan state for generations. They were stripped of citizenship in 1982 and are victims of gross human rights violations.

We urge the UK government to pressure the Myanmar government to:
•Allow humanitarian and medical aid into the affected areas
•Allow the UN unrestricted access to conduct their investigations
•Recognise Rohingya as an official ethnic minority

attributes.action: Change the legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions.
attributes.background:
Due to the UK Adoption Laws birth families have no legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions. 
The only options is to use an Intermediary Agent or to place your name on the Adoption Contact Register hoping the adoptee has already put their name on it, or will do in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to change these laws so that birth families can access the details of their adopted children/siblings.
We propose the following;
The birth family to be able to obtain the  adoption certificate, which shows the name the adoptee, was given after adoption including the adoptive parents names.
County the adoption occurred.
In the first instance the biological parents can obtain these documents.
Siblings to also have the rights to apply for the same information.

attributes.action: Stop free interpreters in the NHS.
attributes.background: Free interpreters are costing the NHS more than £23 million per year. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: More democracy at work: let workers elect representatives to company boards
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister announced her support for a change in company law to allow workers to elect representatives to sit on company boards.

But this welcome proposal for corporate governance reform has been watered down. 

This is unacceptable - democratic representation should not be voluntary.
attributes.additional_details:
“If I’m prime minister ... we’re going to have not just consumers represented on 
company boards, but workers as well.”  - Theresa May, 11th July 2016

Worker representation is not a replacement for existing agreements between companies and trade unions. Nor is it a means of reducing the independence unions.

The TUC has published a report on how the policy could be implemented: https://www.tuc.org.uk/economic-issues/corporate-governance/workplace-issues/all-aboard-making-worker-representation

attributes.action: Revise/Abolish stamp duty rules for first-time property buyers.
attributes.background: First time buyers (FTBs) should not have to pay stamp duty, the legacy agreement whereby this tax was relieved for FTBs should be reinstated. This would alleviate the financial challenges that FTBs face when attempting to get on the housing ladder which is further exacerbated in the South East
attributes.additional_details: There have been Government schemes introduced that are supposed to offset/assist FTBs entering the market however these are grossly prejudice to the London area and elsewhere in the UK. Outer Fringe areas of London have inflated housing markets due to their attractive location for commuting but schemes like the Help-to-Buy & Save-to-Buy have limits of £250,000 which is significantly below the average house price in areas such as Essex.

attributes.action: The UK government should not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.background: The US administration has put forward the climate change denying America First Energy Policy.  Until such time as this policy is reversed and they take clear and measurable steps to reduce C02 emissions the UK must not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whitehouse.gov/america-first-energy

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Stop non-medically qualified persons administering dermal filler.
attributes.background: The aesthetics industry is poorly regulated and the number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections in the UK is growing rapidly. Concern lies mainly with theses individual's ability to assess appropriately as well as recognise and manage complications as and when they arise.
attributes.additional_details: Health professionals in the U.K are concerned about the growing number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections. Anyone can train, get insurance and start injecting members of the public with these substances. There are substantial risks associated with these treatments and whilst doctors and nurses are regulated by their own professional bodies, non-medics are not. They are not regulated or professionally accountable.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 tunnel plan in Longsight Manchester
attributes.background: As a Longsight resident, I have not received information about how the tunnel affects me or what my rights are. Speaking to other residents they feel the same. The impact of this on people's lives and future plans if they end of selling has to be reviewed and the plans on the HS2 tunnel halted.

attributes.action: Esophageal cancer awareness day!
attributes.background:
Esophageal cancer is rare aggressive form of cancer.
People with esophageal cancer may experience the following symptoms or signs. Sometimes people with esophageal cancer do not show any of these symptoms. 
having a mandatory camera at the age of 50-55 is ideal
attributes.additional_details:
*Difficulty and pain with swallowing, particularly when eating meat, bread, or raw vegetables.
*Even liquid may be painful to swallow.
*Pressure or burning in the chest
*Indigestion or heartburn
*Vomiting
*Frequent choking on food
*Unexplained weight loss
*Coughing or hoarseness
*Pain behind the breastbone or in the throat

We need to make the endoscope camera mandatory for persistent cases, also we need to spread the word so having a national esophageal awareness day would be awesome!

attributes.action: To resolve the NHS financial crisis divert foreign aid payments into the NHS
attributes.background: Our whole NHS system is at breaking point and needs more investment. The money has to come from somewhere so rather than give foreign aid money to developed countries who are not suffering a humanitarian crisis give the money to the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: If you don't know how bad things are watch the BBC documentary Hospital, try and get to see your GP or go to A&E and see how long you have to wait. Call an ambulance or simply watch the news - IT'S CHRYSTAL CLEAR THE NHS IS IN CRISIS!!

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal power instead of Dangerous Nuclear Energy
attributes.background:
UK Govt. to Invest in the creation of the Severn barrage and scrap plans for Hinkley Point. The Severn project is renewable, clean energy, it will also provide 5% of the UK's energy requirements, create 50,000 jobs and can be built within just 10 years. 
Nuclear is dirty, profit driven & dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Some facts & quotes about the project.

''The electricity generated would be equivalent to three or four nuclear power stations and thousands of wind turbines & equivalent to 8 large coal-fired power stations. ''

- Lower cost than Hinkley Point.

- The barrage will have an operational lifetime of up to 200 year.

- It would be the world's largest ever renewable energy project.

-  Damages to wildlife from project can be avoided with additional investment of £3 Billion to migrate wildlife.

attributes.action: Compulsory Mindfulness in all Primary Schools
attributes.background: The current education system is destroying our children;it is a system driven by standardised assessments.This is not the education our children need; they need a system that is concerned about their mental wellbeing, not just test scores. The statistics for children's mental health are overwhelming
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 10 children aged between 5-16years has a mental health problem.It is predicted that mental health illness is to be one of the major health burdens of the coming decade.We have a social responsibility for the wellbeing of the next generation.The system is not going to change, but compulsory MINDFULNESS for all primary children could provide them with vital tools to protect their mental wellbeing. Mindfulness has been shown to reduce stress,anxiety and bad behaviour and improve self-esteem.

attributes.action: Pay sick pay to employees who have been in service for more than 2 years
attributes.background: I am a reliable employee who only takes time off when I am genuinely too ill to get to work but will still go in when I'm too unwell to because I do not get sick pay. Yes I'm entitled to SSP but I would have to be off work for more than for days and it doesn't cover my wages.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been at this work post for 4 years and am a reliable, honest and hard working person. I feel it unfair that I and others in my situation do not have our salary protected for a certain number of weeks a year and are forced to either go in to work sick, have our salary compromised or take more time that is required off just to claim SSP, which I have only ever done once. 
I would like to see employers be made to offer sick pay/salary protection to employees in service for over 2 years

attributes.action: Include the dangers of online grooming in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I would like children to be taught about the dangers of online grooming alongside their learning about IT and computers. Paedophiles use the internet to groom young people, but currently this isn't taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Children should be made aware of the dangers around online grooming, and it should be made a part of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Stop aid to countries that have a nuclear/space program put monies saved in NHS
attributes.background: Billions are sent abroad to foreign countries that have nuclear or space programs or both. And our own NHS doesnt have enough funds to survive. Pakistan received over £300.000.0000 from the UK whilst spending millions on their space and nuclear ambitions. Let's readjust and help our NHS .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-34176846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-12607537
http://news.sky.com/story/ae-departments-fail-to-hit-waiting-times-for-16-months-nhs-figures-show-10725757

attributes.action: Implement the recommendations of the Cttee on Economic, Social & Cultural Rights
attributes.background: The UN Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights issued a damning report on the UK’s compliance with international human rights law, and made 60 specific recommendations. The government must explain to Parliament and the British public how it intends to implement them.
attributes.additional_details:
The government missed the opportunity of the 2016 Autumn statement to start decisively allocating the necessary resources to fulfil the economic and social rights recognised in international human rights law. 

Find out more background information here: http://www.just-fair.co.uk/2016-concluding-observations

The UK’s human rights record will be reviewed again in the UN Universal Periodic Review in May 2017.

attributes.action: stop funding the royal family with taxpayers money
attributes.background: the royal family is one of the wealthiest in the world. Whilst I don't wish to be disrespectful to HRH we should stop or at least suspend payments from the civil list
attributes.additional_details: many people are going hungry, living out of food banks, having to choose between rent, food or heating. homelessness has risen to an all time high. front line services are strapped for cash. the british tax payer can no longer afford to fund the lavish lifestyle of one of the wealthiest families in the world.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work a shift on A&E explaining to patients why he's failed us all
attributes.background: We think that Jeremy Hunt should work a shift in any overcrowded A&E Department this winter and go round to every patient, nurse, doctor, ambulance crew and explain how he prepared for this winter and how he's failed us all.
